topic.title: Using CLI
topic.shortdesc: CLI commands for enabling authentication and managing X.509 certificates.

body.section:
enable-servercaauth
Syntaxcouchbase-cli enable-servercaauth -c [host]:8091 -u[admin] -p[password] [options]
DescriptionTLS encryption can be enabled or disabled cluster-wide in Couchbase Server with the command enable-servercaauth, which is set to false by default. This command verifies that all cluster per-node certificates are signed by the same root CA certificate.
Full Couchbase administrators can use enable-servercaauth only when all nodes in a cluster have been upgraded to the release that supports this feature. If some of the nodes are not upgraded to the required release, administrators can use self-signed certificates.
Options
--enable=[0|1] Enables or disables CA authentication.
If no valid CA certificate and key file are loaded on all nodes, this command will fail.
When you have --enble=0, a self-signed certificate should be used; when you have --enble=1, Couchbase Server must validate per node certificates for the cluster.

section.p: This command is used to manage node certificates.

dlentry.dd:
Local file path on the node that contains private key for the node in .key format.
For example: /opt/couchbase/var/lib/couchbase/keys/server.key

Local file path on the node that contains certificate for the node in .pem format.
For example: /opt/couchbase/var/lib/couchbase/keys/server.pem

Local file path on the node that contains CA certificate for the cluster in .pem format.
For example: /opt/couchbase/var/lib/couchbase/keys/cacert.key

Produces a list of certificates for the node (For each node, emits the active node certificate, corresponding active CA root certificate, non-active CA certificate, and thumbprint of the certificate chain.)

section.title: ssl-manage
section.p: The commandssl-manage was available in Couchbase Server 4.x with two options:
The new options are used as follows:

dlentry.dd: Prints available cluster CA info such as type, subject, expiration date, and warnings:
Prints node certificate along with its subject and expiration date:

dd.codeblock: couchbase-cli ssl-manage -c [nodehost ip]:8091 -u[admin] -p[password] \ --upload-cluster-ca=[path to pem encoded root certificate]

dlentry.dt: --set-node-certificate --chain[path to pem encoded certificate chain] --pkey[path to pem encoded private key]
dlentry.dd: Creates inbox folder, copies chain.pem and pkey.pem to the inbox folder, calls POST /node/controller/reloadCertificate

dd.codeblock: couchbase-cli ssl-manage -c [nodehost ip]:8091 -u[admin] -p[password] \ --set-node-certificate --chain[path to pem encoded certificate chain] \ --pkey[path to pem encoded private key]
